intro: Campanula patula, commonly known as the common bellflower, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It features upright stems that bear clusters of bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in well-drained soil in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged alternately along the stem. Campanula patula is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often used in gardens for its attractive blooms and ease of cultivation.
